title: Booking by Phone
en: Call the clinic to make a doctor's appointment. For example: 'Hello, I'd like to book an appointment with Dr. Smith.' The receptionist will confirm the date and time.

title: Booking Online
en: Many clinics let you book appointments online through their website or app. For example: Use the HotDoc app to choose your doctor and time. You need internet access.

title: Booking at Reception
en: You can also book in person at the reception desk. For example: 'I'd like to book an appointment for tomorrow, please.' This is helpful if you live nearby.

title: Bulk-Billing with Medicare
en: Some clinics offer bulk-billing, so you don't pay if you have a Medicare card. For example: 'This clinic is bulk-billing for Medicare holders.' Private clinics may charge fees.

title: Arriving on Time
en: Arrive at least 10 minutes early to check in. For example: 'Please arrive by 9:20 for your 9:30 appointment.' If you are late, you may need to reschedule.

title: Talking to Receptionist
en: Tell the receptionist your name and appointment time. For example: 'My name is Lin. I have an appointment at 10am.' The receptionist will confirm your booking.

title: Doctor Consultation
en: Explain your symptoms clearly to the doctor. For example: 'I have had a headache for three days.' Bring notes if you need help remembering details.

title: Interpreter Support
en: If you don't speak English well, you can ask for a free interpreter. For example: 'I would like an interpreter for my appointment.' This is available through TIS National.

title: Prescriptions
en: Doctors may give you a prescription to buy medicine at a pharmacy. For example: 'Here is your prescription for antibiotics.' Take it to any pharmacy to get your medicine.

title: Follow-up Appointments
en: Sometimes you need to book another appointment for follow-up. For example: 'Please come back in two weeks for a review.' This is important for ongoing conditions.

title: Bringing Medicare Card
en: Always bring your Medicare card or ID for registration. For example: 'Please show your Medicare card.' This helps confirm your eligibility.

title: Private vs Public Clinics
en: Private clinics may charge higher fees than public clinics. For example: 'Private consultation fee is $70.' Always check the fees before booking.

title: Specialist Referrals
en: GPs may refer you to a specialist if needed. For example: 'You need a referral to see a cardiologist.' A referral is a letter from your GP.

title: Telehealth Consultations
en: Some doctors offer video or phone consultations. For example: 'Your Telehealth appointment is at 3pm.' This is useful if you cannot travel.

title: Emergency vs Non-Emergency
en: For emergencies, call 000 or go to the hospital, not a GP clinic. For example: 'Call 000 if you have chest pain.' GPs only handle non-emergencies.

title: After-Hours Clinics
en: Some clinics are open late or on weekends for after-hours care. For example: 'This clinic is open until 11pm.' This is useful for people who work during the day.

title: Medical Certificates
en: Doctors can give you certificates for work or school absences. For example: 'Here is your medical certificate for two days.' Employers usually require this.

title: Confidentiality and Privacy
en: Doctors must keep your medical information private. For example: 'Your records are confidential.' This is protected by law in Australia.

title: Bringing Medical History
en: Bring your past medical records if you have them. For example: 'Please bring your blood test results.' This helps doctors understand your condition.
